para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: The machine configuration and features are described in this section.

list.style: text-indent:-25px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:25px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; color:#000000;

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:25px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:113px left ;
para.text: The Spindle Head is assembled with Ram and mounted together onto the Saddle. The Spindle Head moves up and down to form the Z-axis.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:25px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:113px left ;
para.text: A built-in AC motor drives the Spindle.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:25px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:113px left ;
para.text: The Spindle Bearings are lubricated with grease for life time. The Spindle Head and Motor is jacket-cooled and the generated heat is removed by water-based coolant from Spindle Cooler Unit.

list.style: text-indent:-25px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:25px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; color:#000000;

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:25px; line-height:1.20; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: The Bed is of high-strength structure consisting of multiple ribs. The linear guideways for the Y-axis are mounted on the Bed.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:25px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:113px left ;
para.text: A four-point support structure is employed to improve installation accuracy and stability.

list.style: text-indent:-25px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:25px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; color:#000000;

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:25px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: The Cross Slide is sitting on
Bed casting and carries X & Z axes.

list.style: text-indent:-25px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:25px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; color:#000000;

para.text: The Table is fixed. It comes with tap holes to facilitate clamping of fixture /component for machining. Apart from Standard Table, optional long table is used for specific 4th Axis Application.

list.style: text-indent:-25px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:25px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; color:#000000;

para.text: The RWH comes with Work Spindle for turning and additional station for Fixture Plate Mounting with 4 Hydraulic/Pneumatic Port. Work Spindle is driven by a Torque Motor with Oil based Cooling Jacket. Work Spindle Clamp is actuated by Pneumatics. Tilt Axis is driven by a Servo Motor with Roller Gear Cam Drive. Both the Tilt Axis and Support Unit Clamp is actuate by Hydraulics.

list.style: text-indent:-25px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:25px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; color:#000000;

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:25px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: The Automatic Tool Changer (ATC) consists of
disk-shaped magazine and have shuttle and arm to pick-up and load tool to Spindle. Magazine indexing by servomotor through intermediate gearbox.

list.style: text-indent:-25px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:25px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; color:#000000;

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:25px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: The

Spindle Cooling Oil Temperature Controller circulates cooling oil through the Spindle jacket and front housing and absorbs the generated heat to adjust the temperature of the spindle to that of the machine bed.

list.style: text-indent:-25px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:25px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; color:#000000;

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:25px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: The Grease Supply Unit supplies grease to the drive units of the machine components. As a standard scope machine supplied with Auto Greasing, greasing takes place automatically and Grease Cartridge to be replaced when alarm is triggered by the system.

list.style: text-indent:-25px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:25px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; color:#000000;

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:25px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: The Hydraulic Unit supplies hydraulic oil to the Spindle Head for Tool clamp /unclamp function.

list.style: text-indent:-25px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:25px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; color:#000000;

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:25px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: Cutting chips are flushed away from the machining point using coolant discharge from the Nozzles provided on Spindle Head. Cutting chips on the machine inside chamber are carried out by coolant and discharged into a Chip Bucket (or through the Drum Conveyor - Option).

list.style: text-indent:-25px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:25px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; color:#000000;

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:25px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: The

Machine Controller controls the overall machine operations and functions, including management of tool / workpiece data required for controlling devices such as the Automatic Tool Changer (ATC) for machining.

list.style: text-indent:-25px; margin-bottom:8px; margin-left:25px; font-family:Symbol; font-size:11pt; color:#000000;

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:25px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:11pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: The NC Unit exceeds NC programs and controls axes servomotors and Spindle drive motor.
